instruction: How were the machine learning algorithms utilized in the related study on predicting within-field cotton lint yield at different growth stages?
Output: In the related study, two machine learning algorithms, namely random forest (RF) and gradient boosting machines (GBM), were utilized to predict within-field cotton lint yield at different growth stages. A total of 12 models were created using these algorithms. The models were developed for three growth stages: squaring, flowering, and boll-fill. Two different sets of variables were used in the models: all variables and the optimal variables determined by a recursive feature elimination (RFE) process. The RFE process helped identify the most important variables for predicting cotton yield. The performance of the models was evaluated by comparing the predicted yields with the observed yields. The results showed that the models created using RF algorithm generally provided superior results compared to GBM algorithm, and the models using the optimal variables determined by RFE had similar performance to the models using all variables.
